title: Desert Heat Injury Prevention Protocol
brief: Follow buddy system and specific guidelines to prevent heat injuries in desert survival.
steps: Step 1: Always tell someone your destination and expected return time.
Step 2: Use buddy system - watch each other for heat injury signs.
Step 3: Watch for tiredness or anyone wandering from group - these are heat casualty signs.
Step 4: Rest during day, work during cool evenings and nights.
Step 5: Drink water at least once per hour.
Step 6: Rest in shade, never lie directly on ground.
Step 7: Keep shirt on during day work - do not remove upper body clothing.
warnings: Someone who complains of tiredness or wanders may be a heat casualty.
Direct ground contact increases heat absorption.
Removing shirts during day work leads to sunburn and heat absorption.
source: FM21-76 US Army Survival Manual — US Army (Chapter 13)
